item.title: 国际货币基金组织警告 "软着陆 "中的金融风险依然存在
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）警告市场不要过度繁荣，因为投资者期待中央银行在长达数年的通胀之战中实现 "软着陆"。【原文：The International Monetary Fund is cautioning against overexuberance in markets as investors look for central bankers to pull off a "soft landing" in their years-long inflation battle.】

item.title: 美国 3 月制造业产出增长；2 月数据上修
item.description: 由于汽车装配厂和其他工厂的产量上升，3 月份美国工厂的生产稳健增长，这表明制造业在受到借贷成本上升的制约后正在出现转机。【原文：Production at U.S. factories increased solidly in March as output at motor vehicle assembly plants and elsewhere rose, suggesting that manufacturing was turning the corner after being constrained by higher borrowing costs.】

item.title: 解说员：美国药房福利管理公司为何受到抨击？
item.description: 药房福利管理公司（PBM）是美国国会共和党和民主党的矛头所指，但迄今为止，该公司一直躲避着任何新的诉讼或改革，而上个月的美国政府预算协议曾将这些改革列为目标。【原文：Pharmacy benefit managers (PBMs) are in the crosshairs of Republicans and Democrats in Congress but have so far dodged any new litigation or reforms that had been targeted for inclusion in last month's U.S. government budget deal.】

item.title: 杰斐逊称，如有必要，美联储可在更长时间内保持货币紧缩政策
item.description: 美联储副主席菲利普-杰斐逊（Philip Jefferson）在周二的讲话中只字未提降息，他表示，如果通胀未能如预期般放缓，"将目前的限制性政策立场维持更长时间将是合适的"。【原文：Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson, in remarks devoid of any mention of interest rate cuts, said on Tuesday "it will be appropriate to hold in place the current restrictive stance of policy for longer" if inflation fails to slow as expected.】

item.title: Stellantis 股东批准首席执行官塔瓦雷斯 2023 年薪酬方案
item.description: Stellantis 股东周二批准了支付给汽车制造商高层管理人员的薪酬，其中包括支付给首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯（Carlos Tavares）的价值高达 3,650 万欧元（3,880 万美元）的薪酬。【原文：Stellantis shareholders on Tuesday approved the compensation paid to the carmaker's top management, including a package worth up to 36.5 million euros ($38.8 million) for CEO Carlos Tavares.】

item.title: 耶伦称美国正努力降低全球经济面临的风险
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周二表示，强于预期的美国经济增长为全球经济提供了动力，华盛顿正在努力减轻全球前景面临的剩余风险，并确保可持续的长期增长。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Tuesday said stronger-than-expected U.S. economic growth had helped power the global economy, and Washington was working to mitigate remaining risks to the global outlook and ensure sustainable long-term growth.】

item.title: AMD 推出面向商用笔记本电脑和台式机的人工智能芯片
item.description: 先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices）周二发布了一系列新的人工智能个人电脑芯片，以扩大其在利润丰厚的 "人工智能个人电脑 "市场的份额。【原文：Advanced Micro Devices unveiled a new series of chips for artificial intelligence-enabled personal computers on Tuesday as it looks to expand its share of the lucrative "AI PCs" market.】

item.title: 北方信托因出售债务投资受挫，利润下滑
item.description: 资产与财富管理公司北方信托周二公布，第一季度利润下降了 38%，原因是出售部分债务投资的亏损抵消了服务和管理客户资产的费用收入增加所带来的收益。【原文：Asset and wealth manager Northern Trust posted a 38% fall in first-quarter profit on Tuesday as a loss on the sale of some debt investments offset gains from higher fee income for servicing and managing client assets.】

item.title: 初创公司 Rivos 融资 2.5 亿美元开发 RISC-V 人工智能芯片
item.description: 芯片初创公司 Rivos 周二表示，它在一轮融资中筹集了 2.5 亿美元，这将使它能够生产首款面向人工智能的服务器芯片。【原文：Chip startup Rivos said on Tuesday it raised $250 million in a funding round that will enable it to manufacture its first server chip geared for artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 美国 3 月份独户住宅开工率大幅下降
item.description: 尽管住房需求依然强劲，但抵押贷款利率的回升正将潜在购房者推向观望。【原文：U.S. single-family homebuilding tumbled in March after hefty gains in the prior month, and while demand for housing remains strong, a resurgence in mortgage rates is pushing potential buyers to the sidelines.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡未能与债券持有人就重组条款达成一致
item.description: 斯里兰卡政府周二表示，该国未能与债券持有人就约 120 亿美元的债务重组达成协议，这使该国满足国际货币基金组织（IMF）计划要求的计划变得更加复杂。【原文：Sri Lanka has failed to strike an agreement on restructuring about $12 billion of debt with its bondholders, the government said on Tuesday, complicating the nation's plans to meet the requirements of an IMF programme.】

item.title: 调查显示，美国小型制造商热衷拜登的大型工业计划
item.description: 美国的中小型制造商可能正在热衷于拜登政府推行的积极工业政策。【原文：America’s small and mid-sized manufacturers may be warming up to the Biden administration’s push for an aggressive industrial policy.】

item.title: 投资银行业务复苏，摩根士丹利利润上升
item.description: 摩根士丹利第一季度利润增长，主要得益于投资银行业务的复苏。【原文：Morgan Stanley's profit rose in the first quarter, lifted by a resurgence in investment banking.】

item.title: 利息收入减少，PNC 利润下降 21
item.description: PNC 金融服务公司周二公布的第一季度利润下降了 21%，原因是在高利率环境下，该贷款公司为持有客户存款支付了更多费用，导致利息收入减少。【原文：PNC Financial Services reported a 21% fall in first-quarter profit on Tuesday, hurt by lower interest income as the lender paid more to hold customer deposits in a high interest rate environment.】

item.title: 美国银行利润因客户利息支出减少而下降
item.description: 美国银行第一季度利润下降，原因是其消费部门走弱，贷款机构注销了更多贷款，尤其是信用卡贷款。【原文：Bank of America's first-quarter profit fell as its consumer division weakened and the lender wrote off more loans, particularly for credit cards.】

item.title: 日本日产押注下一代电动汽车的固态电池和千兆传输技术
item.description: 日本日产汽车公司（Nissan Motor）周二表示，该公司将于 2029 年初开始大规模生产电动汽车用固态电池，并将使用大型铸造机，以提高未来车型的效率并降低成本。【原文：Japan's Nissan Motor will begin to produce solid-state batteries for electric vehicles at scale by early 2029 and use huge casting machines as it seeks to raise efficiency and drive down costs on future models, the automaker said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，欧盟将对阻止跨境销售的 Mondelez 公司处以罚款
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周二援引熟知内情的人士的话报道称，欧盟将对奥利奥制造商梦迪尔兹国际公司（Mondelez International）阻碍跨境销售的行为处以罚款。【原文：The European Union is set to fine Oreo maker Mondelez International for blocking cross-border sales, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 德国政府消息人士称，世界经济将摆脱衰退，但增长速度过低
item.description: 德国政府消息人士称，全球经济衰退的危险已基本解除，但经济增长将十分微弱，他指的是国际货币基金组织将于周二晚些时候公布的预测。【原文：The danger of a global recession has largely been averted but growth will be meagre, German government sources said, referring to International Monetary Fund forecasts that will be published later on Tuesday.】

item.title: 服务费增加，纽约梅隆银行季度业绩超出华尔街预期
item.description: 纽约梅隆银行周二利润增长 5%，超出华尔街预期，原因是资产价值上升提高了投资服务费，抵消了全球最大托管银行较低的利息收入。【原文：Bank of New York Mellon beat Wall Street expectations on Tuesday with a 5% increase in profits, as rising asset values boosted investment services fees, more than offsetting lower interest income for the world's largest custodian bank.】

item.title: 抗癌药物强劲，J&J 公司第一季度利润超出预期
item.description: 强生公司（Johnson & Johnson）周二公布的第一季度利润高于华尔街预期，主要得益于其抗癌药物（包括最畅销的血癌治疗药物 Darzalex）的强劲销售。【原文：Johnson & Johnson reported a first-quarter profit above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, helped by strong sales of its cancer drugs including top-selling blood cancer treatment Darzalex.】

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普的媒体公司将分阶段推出流媒体平台
item.description: 特朗普媒体与技术集团周二表示，将分阶段推出电视直播流媒体平台。【原文：Trump Media & Technology Group said on Tuesday it would roll out a live TV streaming platform in phases.】

item.title: 沃尔玛支持的 Ibotta 期待在规模扩大的美国 IPO 中融资 5.51 亿美元
item.description: 由沃尔玛支持的数字营销公司 Ibotta 周二表示，该公司正寻求在美国进行规模更大的首次公开募股，筹资约 5.51 亿美元。【原文：Ibotta, the digital marketing company backed by Walmart , said on Tuesday it was looking to raise about $551 million in an upsized initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 中东紧张局势加剧，债券收益率持续走高，期货市场趋于缓和
item.description: 周二，美国股指期货走低，受国债收益率上升的影响，投资者对中东冲突保持警惕，转而关注公司财报以衡量经济实力。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged lower on Tuesday, weighed by elevated Treasury yields as investors remained wary of the conflict in the Middle East, turning the lens on company earnings to gauge the strength of the economy.】

item.title: 美联储主席鲍威尔和杰斐逊将 "限制性 "政策与强劲数据对立起来
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）和副主席菲利普-杰斐逊（Philip Jefferson）将发表很可能是他们在美国央行下次会议前的最后一次公开评论，他们将试图把一个万有引力的经济与他们对货币政策 "限制性 "和通胀可能正在下降的评估相协调。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell and Vice Chair Philip Jefferson will make what are likely to be their last public comments before the U.S. central bank's next meeting, as they try to reconcile a gravity-defying economy with their assessment that monetary policy is "restrictive" and inflation likely on its way down.】

item.title: 元监督委员会审查人工智能制作的名人色情片的处理情况
item.description: Meta Platforms 监督委员会周二表示，该委员会正在审查公司对其 Facebook 和 Instagram 服务上流传的两张人工智能生成的女明星性爱图片的处理方式。【原文：Meta Platforms' Oversight Board is reviewing the company's handling of two sexually explicit AI-generated images of female celebrities that circulated on its Facebook and Instagram services, the board said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 早间竞价：红火的零售业绩推动美国经济和美元走势
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 联合健康预计，Change Healthcare 的黑客攻击将在今年对联合健康造成每股最多 1.35 美元的损失。
item.description: 联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）预计，其 Change Healthcare 部门 2 月份遭受的网络攻击将对全年利润造成高达每股 1.35 美元的冲击，因为该公司正在努力恢复服务并将黑客攻击造成的影响降至最低。【原文：UnitedHealth Group expects to take a hit of as much as $1.35 per share to full-year profit from disruptions caused by the February cyberattack at its Change Healthcare unit as it works to restore services and minimize the fallout from the hack.】

item.title: 英特尔将为中国推出两款人工智能芯片，功能有所减弱
item.description: 为了遵守美国的出口管制和制裁，英特尔将面向中国市场发布两款功能有所减弱的人工智能芯片。【原文：Intel will release two AI chips with reduced capabilities for the Chinese market, in order to comply with U.S. export controls and sanctions.】

item.title: 美国贸易代表戴志康表示正在 "认真研究 "应对中国的工具
item.description: 美国贸易代表凯瑟琳-戴（Katherine Tai）将于周二告诉立法者，拜登政府正在 "认真审视 "美国的贸易保护工具，以应对中国经贸政策带来的威胁，包括审查特朗普时代对中国进口商品征收的关税。【原文：U.S. Trade Representative Katherine Tai will tell lawmakers on Tuesday that the Biden administration is "taking a serious look" at U.S. trade defense tools to deal with threats posed by China's trade and economic policies, including a review of Trump-era tariffs on Chinese imports.】

item.title: 特斯拉全球裁员包括主要市场美国和中国
item.description: 五位知情人士透露，特斯拉的全球裁员包括在美国和中国这两个汽车制造商最大的市场裁员，涉及销售、技术和工程等领域。【原文：Tesla's global job cuts include reducing staff in the U.S. and China, the automakers' two biggest markets, across sales, tech, and engineering, five sources briefed on the matter said.】
